text.section:
This section does not apply to any information that a person discloses:
In performing a public duty to report on or take special action about the business of a credit union;
In testifying as a witness in a criminal proceeding; or
In informing any official, officer, employee, or agent of a credit union under examination of the results of that examination.

section.section:

The Commissioner may give the National Credit Union Administration Share Insurance Program information about a credit union if:
The credit union is insured by the National Credit Union Administration Share Insurance Program; or
The credit union:

text.section:
Except as otherwise provided by law, all confidential information disclosed to any person as permitted under this section:
Remains the property of the Commissioner; and
May not be further disclosed by that person without the written permission of the Commissioner.

A person that violates any provision of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to:
Forfeiture of the person's office or employment; and
A fine not exceeding $1,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 2 years or both.
